nodes.text: Camur was a soldier in the Republic Army during the year 3640 BBY, who fought in the Galactic War between the Galactic Republic and the reconstituted Sith Empire. Camur was assigned to Sergeant Shanra Immel's squad and served with Republic Special Forces Division Colonel Jace Malcom during a battle on the Inner Rim planet Kalandis Seven. Camur and the squad were tasked with the destruction of the local spaceport, and after reaching the spaceport, they were ultimately successful in their mission.

In 3640 BBY, Camur served as a soldier in the Republic Army during the Galactic War between the Galactic Republic and the resurgent Sith Empire. During a battle on the desolate Inner Rim planet Kalandis Seven, Camur was part of Sergeant Shanra Immel's squad and served with SpecForce Colonel Jace Malcom. During the battle, the squad was tasked with the destruction of the local Sith–controlled spaceport. Along the way to the spaceport they were attacked and Corporal Amden vor Keioidian, a fellow member of Camur's squad, was fatally wounded. Camur's sergeant, Immel, activated Keioidian's med tracer before leaving him behind.

Three hours later, Camur and the squad reached their objective and checked in with Immel before proceeding with their mission. Malcom attempted to capture the Sith Planetary command ship that recently landed, while Camur and the squad started planting their targeting beacons, which would allow their starfighters to destroy the spaceport regardless of the fog. Shortly after, Malcom failed to capture the command ship and the spaceport was destroyed by Republic fighters.

Camur first appeared, albeit voice only, in Alexander Freed's short story The Last Battle of Colonel Jace Malcom which was published in Star Wars Insider 137 and released on October 23, 2012. Camur's species and gender were not identified in the short story.
